Title: SCUBA Diving
Prerequisites: Q4 2026. Tue/Thu dates: 4/16, 4/23, 4/28, 4/30, 5/5, 5/7, 5/12. Meet at Alumni Wang pool/Classroom 66-160 after. All participants must complete PE&W Swim/Boat test by 3/11 to register along with passing SCUBA pre-test on day 1, able to lift 40 lbs and in good health. Must complete all documentation forms from PE&W to confirm registration by 3/16 @5p. Attendance is required on the first and last day.
Equipment: Bathing suit or shorts and shirt. Equipment provided by United Divers for pool sessions. A mask, booties, fins and a snorkel must be purchased for open water dives.
Waivers: Waivers, Emergency Contact and Insurance Information required. Forms will be sent from the PE&W office using the student's MIT email by the close of online registration. Check SPAM folders if emails are being forwarded from an MIT email account. UD SDI Medical waiver must be completed and sent to UD before day 1 of class. Waivers are located on the UD website. Note: by answering NO to any question, a doctor's signature is NOT needed. Contact traininguniteddivers@gmail.com with any questions.

Title: Pistol
Prerequisites: Students must attend first 4 classes, though attendance at all classes is strongly recommended.
Equipment: Baseball style hats (old fashioned type with the brim to the front, not the rear), are mandatory. All other equipment will be provided. If students own their own protective shooting glasses and/or hearing protection they may use same after approval by the instructor.

Title: Sailing
Prerequisites: 2025/2026- Q4 classes-  Thu dates: 4/2, 4/9, 4/16, 4/23, 4/30, 5/7 -- Time: 1-2:30p. Must successfully complete swim and boat test by 3/11. Students must attend first 2 classes and complete 5 classes to pass the course.
Equipment: Filled water bottle. DO NOT WEAR COTTON. Wear tennis shoes. Synthetic, warm clothing recommended. Note: there are no restrooms available in the Sailing Pavilion.

Title: Kayak
Prerequisites: Q4:Tue: 4/21, 4/28, 5/5 (Thu, 5/7*weather back up). Students must attend ALL 3 classes to receive PE&W points. All participants must successfully complete swim and boat test by 3/11. Students must complete all forms sent from PE&W office to the student MIT email to confirm online registration by Mon, 3/16 @5p.  Check SPAM folders if emails are being forwarded from an MIT email account.
Equipment: Swimsuit or synthetic shirt and shorts/tights are required. Fleece jacket and warm clothes, as needed. Check materials section in Canvas for detailed list. All other equipment provided by Charles River Canoe & Kayak- kayak, paddle, PFD, dry suit and jacket.
Waivers: MIT waiver to the Physical Education & Wellness Office. Charles River Canoe & Kayak waiver and located on Canvas site - bring with you to day 1 of class.

Title: Backpacking - Urban
Prerequisites: Q4: 4/10-4/12 (not applicable for June 2026 intended graduates), Pre-trip meeting: Wed, 3/18 at 5:15p-6:45p; Fitness Sessions (choose 1): Thu, 3/19 or Tue, 4/2 at 5p-6p. Must complete all forms provided by PE&W office to confirm registration by Mon, 3/16 at 11a.
Equipment: Gather or borrow bandana/handkerchief, synthetic clothing- pants and shirts, sturdy shoes or boots, baseball cap, rain coat and pants, winter hat and mittens.
Waivers: Waivers, Emergency Contact and Insurance Information required. Forms will be sent from the PE&W office using the student's MIT email by the close of online registration. Check SPAM folders if emails are being forwarded from an MIT email account.

Title: Sailing, Intermediate: Applied Physics
Prerequisites: Beginner sailing or equivalent. 2025/2026- Q4 classes- Tue dates: 4/7, 4/14, 4/28, 5/5, 5/12 (must attend all 5 dates); Time: 11-12:30p. Must successfully complete swim and boat test by 3/11. Students must attend first 2 classes and complete 5 classes to pass the course.
Equipment: Dress in layers. Filled water bottle. DO NOT WEAR COTTON. Wear tennis shoes that can get wet. Synthetic, warm clothing recommended. Note: there are no restrooms available in the Sailing Pavilion.

Title: Wellness Foundations (remote asynchronous)

Internet access, computer (or tablet, mobile device) with a camera, microphone, and working speaker, MIT Zoom account, comfortable with using 'camera on' function during Zoom sessions.
